meanings.definition: A category within a family unit, typically consisting of related individuals.
meanings.sent1: In our big family, we have different subfamilies like the cousins and aunts.
meanings.sent2: The reunion was a joyful gathering of all the subfamilies, sharing stories and laughter.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, the subfamilies competed in a friendly game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The school can be seen as a forest, with classrooms as subfamilies of students learning together.
meanings.sent5: The subfamilies in the neighborhood often organize potlucks to strengthen their bonds.

meanings.definition: A taxonomic rank below family and above genus.
meanings.sent1: The biologist studied the subfamilies of plants to understand their evolutionary relationships.
meanings.sent2: The subfamilies of insects were classified based on their physical characteristics.
meanings.sent3: In the zoo, the subfamilies of primates each had their own unique behaviors.
meanings.sent4: The subfamilies of stars in the galaxy twinkled like distant lanterns in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the subfamilies of fish, the marine biologist discovered new species in the ocean depths.
